Identification.ShortTitle: Special Voting Rules Referendum Fees Tariff
Identification.LongTitle: Tariff of Fees, Costs, Allowances and Expenses for Special Returning Officers and Other Persons Employed at or with Respect to a Referendum Under the Special Voting Rules

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the President of the Privy Council, pursuant to subsection 11(1) of the Special Voting Rules (Schedule II to the Canada Elections Act), as adapted by regulations made by the Chief Electoral Officer on July 14, 1992* pursuant to section 7 of the Referendum Act**, and subsection 12(2) of the Special Voting Rules (Schedule II to the Canada Elections Act) as that provision applies pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the Referendum Act**, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Tariff of fees, costs, allowances and expenses for special returning officers and other persons employed at or with respect to a referendum under the Special Voting Rules.

Footnote.Text: SOR/92-430, 1992 Canada Gazette Part II, p. 3126

Section.Text: This Tariff may be cited as the Special Voting Rules Referendum Fees Tariff.

The fees, costs, allowances and expenses set out in the schedule shall be paid to special returning officers, chief assistants, scrutineers and clerical assistants employed at or with respect to a referendum under the Special Voting Rules.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Fees, Costs, Allowances and Expenses Payable to Referendum Officers

row.entry: During a Referendum

Provision.Text: Each special returning officer shall be paid, for all services performed by the special returning officer during a referendum,

row.entry: Special Assignments

Provision.Text: Where at any time the Chief Electoral Officer requests a special returning officer to carry out a special assignment, the officer shall be paid

row.entry: a) a fee for all services performed in connection with that assignment, per hour, of
b) for living expenses in connection with the services referred to in paragraph (a)
the allowances established by the Treasury Board Travel Directive, at the rates in effect at the time the services are performed
Information Sessions on Referendum Matters

Provision.Text: Where the Chief Electoral Officer requests that a special returning officer attend a training session or a referendum debriefing session, the officer shall be paid

row.entry: a) for each day of attendance at a training session
b) for each day of attendance at a referendum debriefing session
c) for meals and incidental expenses at the place where the session is held if that place is not the place of residence of the officer
the allowances established by the Treasury Board Travel Directive, at the rates in effect at the time of attendance
During a Referendum

Provision.Text: Each chief assistant shall be paid, for all services performed by the chief assistant during a referendum,

row.entry: Special Assignments

Provision.Text: Where at any time the Chief Electoral Officer requests a chief assistant to carry out a special assignment, the chief assistant shall be paid

row.entry: a) a fee for all services performed in connection with that assignment, per hour, of
b) for living expenses in connection with the services referred to in paragraph (a)
the allowances established by the Treasury Board Travel Directive, at the rates in effect at the time the services are performed
Information Sessions on Referendum Matters

Provision.Text: Where the Chief Electoral Officer requests that a chief assistant attend a training session or a referendum debriefing session, the chief assistant shall be paid

row.entry: a) for each day of attendance at a training session
b) for each day of attendance at a referendum debriefing session
c) for meals and incidental expenses at the place where the session is held if that place is not the place of residence of the chief assistant
the allowances established by the Treasury Board Travel Directive, at the rates in effect at the time of attendance

Provision.Text: Each scrutineer shall be paid, for all services performed by the scrutineer during a referendum,

row.entry: $77.80 per day, not to exceed $1,478.20 in the aggregate

Provision.Text: Each clerical assistant shall be paid, for all services performed by the clerical assistant during a referendum,

row.entry: $62.50 per day

Provision.Text: In the voting territories referred to in subsections 5(1) and (2) of the Special Voting Rules, the special returning officers, chief assistants and scrutineers shall be paid, for meals and incidental expenses in respect of necessary travel away from their place of residence in connection with the conduct of a referendum,

row.entry: the allowances established by the Treasury Board Travel Directive, at the rates in effect on the day of the issue of the writ
